meaning: The main inbound conveyor loop feeding all tote systems in CFC1 (miniload cranes and OSR systems).
Task b
Utopia

Automation Control Software area (also known as the PLC area)
The software used to directly control the automation (conveyors, cranes etc) in Ocado CFCs
ACS
A system to allow non-OSP systems external to the CFC to communicate with OSP style CFCs, as well as potentially to allow CFC1 and CFC2 to communicate with Atmosphere in the future.
Approved Driving Instructor
An OSP branding for UIs.

Automated Guided Vehicle
Similar to PPT but automated. Not currently in use anywhere.

Atlas Information System
See MIS
Section of the website showing a particular group of products e.g. “Baked Beans, Spaghetti & Pasta” (EXAMPLE)

The process of reserving stock within the warehouse to fulfil a customer’s order. If an item is not available then it may be substituted with a similar one. In CFC1 & 2, once an order has been allocated then the picks cannot be changed, they can only be scratched (see: Scratch).
Ocado Contact Centre system
Aloe is Contact Center Database for Ocado and Vera is the similar version for Morrisons side
An area of a CFC or LGV or van where goods that are not required to be kept chilled or frozen are stored
Automated Material Handling Systems Association
An application for providing a single write point into a cassandra cluster. It reads data from RabbitMQ. Newer systems use Adder, which is a web service.

Accounts Payable
The team who deal with expenses, paying suppliers and other invoices

Access Point
Appointment Number (used when receiving stock into the warehouse) / Access Point (hardware for wireless LAN)
A group of inbound stock Purchase Orders that appear on the same lorry.

Ambient Pallet Routing
A subsystem of the WMS which manages the movement of pallets around the CFC. Only in CFC1.

Auto Recovery Bot
Larger than production and autonomous bot used to recover production bots on the grid while it is live.
A temporary storage location for an each, or a SKU, before picking it into a customer container.
Additional Roster Time
See Profibus

Automatic Storage and Order Picking Systems 
A highly efficient picking system where ST and DT totes are fetched to picking stations in a synchronised way. Current ASOPS systems: OSR1, OSR2 (CFC1) and MASOPS (CFC2).

Available Source of Supply (RMS terminology) 
Indicates where and how a product is currently sourced (pricing information, supplier, etc.). For a product, at any time there will be a single active ASOS per CFC.

Automated Storage and Retrieval System (CFC1 only)
It is cranes for storage totes, mainly containing products that can either be picked in Chill or Ambient, as it is itself ambient but CFC1 doesn’t pick from STs other than in OSR1, OSR2 and Chill.
An inter-CFC application to manage Totes, Dollies, PPTs and other assets that can be moved between CFCs. In particular, it handles defective dollies.
This term covers all storage containers and totes,  Ifco's, Delivery totes ( DT's), Storage totes ( ST's ), Freezer totes ( FT's )
See Product Slotting.

Answer Too Late (from WCS or WMS)
In order to maintain flow on conveyors the PLC requires a response from the WCS to a routing request within a fixed amount of time (typically 0.5s) if a response is not received a default action configured within the PLC will be carried out and an ATL reported to the WCS.
A real-time in-memory high-level system managing hardware and stock. Contains business logic.
All of OSP that is not CFC Software (see also Phoenix). Includes Routing and Delivery, Supply Chain, Business Planning, Employee Management and Range Management.

Available To Promise (sometimes 'purchase')
System which deals with stock which is considered available for the Webshop.

Adenosine Tri-Phosphate 
MSC swabbing

Applicant Tracking System
Used by Ocado recruitment teams to manage online job applications

The system whereby Freezer inventory is created. Because it would be very labour-intensive otherwise, almost all Freezer Decant happens at a Freezer Warehouse called Theale. Therefore the inventory has already been created before it arrives in the CFC. In OSP-style CFCs this is handled by a special logical zone. (Some inventory in the freezer is picked from pallets.)
The storage system used in NFDC.
Work done that can't be counted with a UPH, like Dry Icing or Cleaning up or reverse flows. Usually the user logs into this using an MIS page rather than through a station or RF gun.

Ambient Zone Pick
The ambient (room temperature) area of the CFC where items are picked and packed. Can also refer to the ambient pallet crane system

Business Central 
term for Business Support, Business Planning and Supply Chain, General Merchandise, Human Resources, Development and Engineering, Grocery Retail
A barcode scanner (Bar Code Reader).
Belt Driven Roller Conveyor

A process where big and bulky items (eg. 6 packs of 1.5 ltr water) are decanted directly into delivery totes which are then stored until such a tote is required at allocation. It only exists in Dordon, where certain MASOPS-like towers without pickstations are set aside for such DTs.
A collective noun for very large sets of data, typically larger than would traditionally be handled in Data Warehouses.
Relates to PandaSSO deployed on premise. Used to login to google, amazon and other services used inside by Ocado employees
A scalable engine built by Google to scan and aggregate data with SQL-like syntax. Used on CDP as a storage for most of the data and also used as a processing engine when suitable.

A formal education programme in which a student learns, at least in part, through delivery of content and instruction via digital and online media with some element of student control over time, place, path, or pace
Business Management Tools

Brave New Universe 
Project methodology whereby Ocado manages mechanical and electrical suppliers, and acts as integrator
fTs and STs are pushed around on such trolleys in the freezer. There are inbound and outbound trolleys.

Back of Pack
On webshop, a page or UI element which shows all the information we have about a product
A container that is about half the size of a tote. This is only used in AZP3A and AZP3Z in CFC1 and requires a dedicated conveyor and crane system for transportation (crane 16.1 and 16.2)

Business Project Manager 
Another term used to refer to Logistics Development project managers

Bag Placement System
Another term for one of the three modules that make up a bagging machine.
External company that sends us information on products eg. images and BOPinformation

Only in Dordon (AZP0A). Unlike other aisles, it is replenished entirely by an RF Process. The aisle is deliberately placed near the inbound door so that products with a short shelf life can be put there.
Barcode Read Message
Rcom Base Station

Bigger Than A Tote
This refers to items that won't fit in a tote. This is handled in the NFDC using Courier Pick.

A segregation of the CFC operating day - by splitting the day into sections, stock that is not in the warehouse at the start of the shift can still be considered available to a later bucket, thus providing a more just-in-time (JIT) relation between incoming stock and fulfilling customer orders.
An application that provides a read-only view of JMS hubs for reporting, so that slow reporting consumers don’t endanger the control system

When associated with an ASOPS shuttle is the PnD location for the shuttle that is shared with the lift. The lift drops a tote in one buffer, the shuttles picks from that buffer, the shuttle can drop a tote in a buffer and the lift can pick from that buffer. In zone pick aisles we call this a vPnD but in ASOPS the vendor called it a buffer, so all the documentation uses buffer.
A lorry that is divided into Chill and Ambient sections by a movable partition (As opposed to a Double Decker trailer, which has Ambient on one level and Chill on the other).

Chill A loop  
(not completed yet)
A Marketing System used to allocate incentives to customers (e.g. vouchers, Smart Pass discounts).
A barcode, usually an EAN, where the price of the each is stored within the barcode.
A barcode, usually an EAN, where the weight of the each is stored within the barcode. Used for products like Cheese.

Counter Balance 
A traditional fork lift truck
Chill B Loop

Clutch Brake Unit
The powered roller that drives a section of accumulation conveyor (usually around 7 rollers total).
Chill C Loop

Change Control Notification
Process with Morrisons for changes
Construction (Design & Management)

Content Delivery Management boxes
Unit that compliments scanners at pick stations (processing unit).

Customer Delivery System 
Anything that involves software for the Drivers & Customer Service Department

Container Discovery Service.  It's used when a container hasn't transitioned properly between zones. Specifically it informs us which IDs the container matches up with so that we can match it up with the work we have planned
ContainerDeliverToTransitionLocationEvent, it's an event to tell Phoenix where the container is
ContainerDeliveredToTransitionLocationNotification Phoenix (N) tells the new zone the container has arrived
Capital Expenditure Group
One of the electrical contractors used by Ocado.

Customer Fulfilment Centre 
We currently have three CFCs: Hatfield, Dordon and Andover, and we have a fourth being built in Erith. The CFCs are distribution centres where we pick and pack all our Ocado website customer goods from. We also have a General Merchandising Distribution Centre in Welwyn, where our destination websites 'Fetch' and 'Sizzle' operate from.
Chartered Institute of Management Accounting
Construction in progress - asset on the fixed asset register but not yet it use.
Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development

Component Integration Testing
Built to mimic the live system as closely as possible in terms of architecture and structure
Construction Industry Training Board
Gateway to various Ocado applications (remote access to servers)
Can I Wave Plan

The next generation platform which stores and enables reporting, insight and advanced analytics by the Data Science team on all analytical events of our retailer businesses, i.e. Ocado, Morrisons, and future OSP clients
Customer Order Excellence Team
E.g. a bin, Rainbow Tote, Delivery Tote, Freezer Tote etc.
Software interface to Dash Controller, and associated team
Putting a container in another container.

Where in a container inventory or another container is. Bags in DTs are container positions, with a position for the wine cooler another position under the bags. Slots for totes in trolleys and dollies are also positions. Some containers (eg pallets) trivially contain one position for the entire container.

Customer order processor. 
It's a main component responsible for outbound route processing, it allocates stock for routes, creates tasks for warehouse zones and coordinates container moves.

Check Out Walk
The steps a customer goes through during the checkout process
Customer Pack - see MSC Containers

Customer Route
Secondary physical parking/staging locations in Tote Buffer/Dispatch areas

Change Request
A means of logging and tracking information related to a change to any system. Used to control the implementation of changes.

Automation within Ocado CFCs to transports Totes, Pallets, Trays or Boxes from Inbound to Storage or Pickface locations. Typically a single crane will operate in an aisle serving a number of floors and pickfaces but in some areas two cranes per aisle are used.

Candidate Relationship Management
A system to assist recruiters in managing communications with job applicants.
Company Sickness Benefit
Construction Skills Certification Scheme

Conveyor System Integration 
Conveyor supplier. Most conveyors are now supplied by TGW instead.

Customer Service Team Member
Our CSTMs are our delivery drivers responsible for delivering our customers' order to their doors within a timed delivery slot.
Chill Trolley Picking
Click Through Rate
Process owned by the CFC that calculates how items should be picked into totes. i.e. in which order, using how many totes. See also: pre-cubing.
Attaching equipment to a conveyor system that is already live

Chill Zone Pick
The chilled area of the CFC where items are picked and packed

Direct to Spoke 
The business process of shipping NF items direct to a spoke instead of first merging at a CFC

Deed of Appointment (or Design Appointment)
The Legal document used to appoint consultants when designing MHE or properties for Ocado

Data Access Object 
A class in an application which represents a piece of data in a database.
A synonym for the storage component of the Cloud Data Platform, which includes both BigQuery and Google Cloud Storage
The single source of truth for all metadata and definitions relating to derived and reporting objects for all of our retailers, i.e. Ocado, Morrisons and future OSP clients
Database

Distribution Board
An electrical cabinet housing the electrical infeed and circuit breakers for devices in an area.
Database Administrator

Double Decker 
Relates to LGVs with an upstairs and a downstairs

Delivery Date
The date on which the customer will receive the shopping

The process of moving stock from pallets into totes. Sometimes used to refer to the zone in the CFC where decanting occurs. A single decant is a type of inventory move. (In CFC1 this also uses trays and boxes.)

The process of removing used bags, returned stock, etc. from delivery totes that have returned to the CFC after a delivery. Also used to refer to the area of the CFC where this process occurs, and sometimes the materials that are removed from the tote. Also used to describe the process of removing totes from a van and preparing them for re-induct (verb)

When used as a verb, refers to the unloading of delivery totes that have come back to CFCs at the end of a delivery route.
When used as a noun, refers to the area of the CFC where unloading takes place

Any piece of transformed data, whether the input source are raw events or static data, which is "clean" and clearly defined, and can be used for reporting or analytical purposes. The Data Engineering team are creating these initially.
The sites owned by Ocado that are not ocado.com. Currently we have fetch.co.uk, sizzle.co.uk and fabled.com.
The removal of cardboard and plastic from a location.  This is a manual task that is carried out by PS. It is a task that helps keep the area tidy and enables people to pick at a more effective rate.
Destination Message

If the supplier is the retailer itself, the supplier is considered “direct”. For instance, if we have an Appointment with Morrisons inventory which is also retailed by Morrisons. This is used to determine how long we can leave appointments open for.
Taking frame loaded dollies and putting them on vehicles. It is made up of Inside Marshalling, Outside Marshalling and Vehicle Loading. It is an RF Process.
Delivery Bag (Freezer)

Demand Manager Job title in Supply Chain.  The job holder is responsible for balancing product ordering to ensure that the SKU is ATP (available to promise) for our customers but not too much to minimise purge as well as liaison with suppliers, collaborating with inbound and with payables.

Development Notification
A document shared with Morrisons to explain new developments being made available to Ocado and Morrisons

Metal frames into which DTs and FTs are loaded with totes to be put into vehicles. External totes also arrive from the NFDC in dollies. Traditionally, there are two ambient and two chill dollies in each route and 20 totes in each dolly (but in non-UK CFCs this may be different). They tend to have LPNs starting with DX. Also varyingly referred to as frames, cages, rollcages.
A device used to connect two Profibus devices (such as PLCs) and enable communications between them.

Drops per Van 
The number of stops for a particular van on its route. A key metric that the business seeks to maximise
A shopping delivery to a customer on a route.
Dry ice in three dosages (small / medium / large) put into bagged FTs when they are picked.
Data Science / Scientist. See also PDS = Platform Data Scientist and RDS = Research Data Scientist.
Display Screen Equipment - Standards for employee working environment

Desktop Support Services
The team in Technology for everyday IT issues based in CFC1, CFC2, CFC3 and Head Office (Trident Building 2)

Delivery Tote
A tote in the outbound process which will contain items for delivery to a customer (sometimes referred to as a pick tote if there are outstanding picks for it).
 Delivery totes are red.

Delivery Tote Machine
Combined TIM (Tote In Machine) and TOM (Tote Out Machine) machine within Rainbow system.
Development Team Manager
Direct to Spoke

Data Warehouse
A database system used to store and archive historical data. Also the team that maintains this.
An item that can be picked in the CFC; a single item of stock; a product item. Product or unit. Often used as “We sold 3 eaches last week”, or “The average number of eaches per basket is down 0.5”

European Article Number
A product identification number, normally encoded as a 13-digit barcode, that is an internationally unique ID for a product.

Exhaust Cloaking Device 
A shield fitted to LGV tractor units with snorkel exhausts to encourage any emissions away from the cab of the tractor unit
Empty Container Outflow
Electrotechnical Certification Scheme

Employee Management Systems
Responsible for handscanners, Miocado and timesheets.
See Oversight

Engineering Project Manager
(Usually) the Engineering lead on a project (see also BPM).
Engineering Project Manager
Employee Planning Systems
Electric Pump Truck
Our 3rd party payroll company who you will receive your payslips from via email
Emergency Stop
Extract, Transform and Load
Extended Trolley Pick
Used by Inbound Atlas to communicate between the WMS and Atlas.
The process whereby totes from the NFDC arrive in the CFC to be combined with CFC totes into dollies.

Factory Acceptance Testing
The process of testing a physical product (usually from a third party) before it is delivered, to ensure it is operating fundamentally as expected
Functional Design Specification
The Routing optimiser, part of Loki maintained by the Routing part of LMS. This optimises van routes for drive times (as calculated by Odin), volumes and the like.

Frame Loaded / Frame Loader 
A frame loader's role is to load totes to frames that are put into vans/trailers
Application used to monitor tote throughput and picking in the Outbound part of the CFC.
Forklift Lift Truck
A monitoring application used in Webshop (and other parts of Atmosphere?)
Flow Manager
ods

Fleet Management System
A System used to see the vans that are on and off the road at all sites. Also used for raising defect, monitoring services and regular cleaning of each vehicle. Also used to complete incident reports and hold ocument vehicles.

Front of Pack
On Webshop, the UI element which shows a picture of a product and some basic information about it.
The decision as to how to order stock in a dolly so that it is not top-heavy or dangerous to lift. In CFC1&2 this is part of the tote buffer, in OSP-type CFCs it is a WMS function.

The area or process of loading totes that are ready for delivery into dollies (or “frames”) ahead of loading onto a van for delivery. It is an RF Process. A single frame load of a container into another container is a type of Container Load

Flow Rate Control
The point at the entrance to a pick aisle at which totes will be held until the aisle is sufficiently empty for the totes to be released
FTs and STs are pushed around on such trolleys in the freezer. There are inbound and outbound trolleys.

Freezer Tote
Same as DT but contains Freezer items only and will contain items for up to 3 orders (3 customers), 1 order per bag. This necessitates each bag to be considered a distinct container (a DL or freezer bag) in a way not so for other containers.
Freezer totes are blue.
Freezer Trolley Pick
File Transfer Protocol
STL - One of the programming formats used when programming PLCs via Step 7. Other include Ladder Logic, STL and SCL
Optimised picking process where items in one pick station zone that is very busy can be picked from an adjoining station that has less work queued up.
As a customer you could possibly be in multiple zones, each customer has a primary zone. Fuzzy zoning allows for more optimal route planning by allowing customers to move between zones.

Freezer 
An enclosed section of the CFC kept at -25C. It uses trolley pick.
See Oversight
Group Control

General Merchandise
General Merchandise is a division in Ocado

General Manager 
General Manager is a job title in CFC Operations and Service Delivery

General Merchandise Distribution Centre 
This is the place where General Merchandise (aka Non Food) items are stored and picked for all Ocado customers. It is located in Welwyn Garden City, Hertfordshire.
GCS - Google's version of block storage (like S3 is in Amazon-land), a cornerstone of the Ocado Data Lake and Cloud Data Platform
Grid rapid access frame - used in CFC Andover
The Grapevine is our company intranet site. It is a hub for the latest Ocado news, business developments and useful employee information. Go directly to it by clicking the link on the left.
Gravity Conveyor
A old database containing Web Analytics Data, this is being replaced by BigQuery

Are bits of conveyor for moving bins between the ambient and chill grids. Normally this is to balance routes by moving totes from Ambient to Chill (occasionally it's the other way around), and sending empty containers back the other way so we have the correct number of bins in each zone.

Graphical User Interface
The screen Personal Shoppers receive instructions on while picking/decanting
A central location in the CFC where uniform can be ordered, radios can be collected, batteries changed, ID cards created, forms are located and much more
Health and Safety
Hazardous Analysis and Critical Control Points
The day’s/week’s operational limit on the number of orders we can sell. This is determined by CFCpicking capacity and the CSTMand Personal shopper labour.
See SCADA
Hazardous Materials

A principle that applications should periodically send JMS messages to show they are online, as well as a library to allow this in classic control systems. In OSP-style CFCs, the /health-check URL is used for a similar purpose.
A modular, themable collection of components for modern browsers.

Human Machine Interface
Usually used to refer to the physical controls for an item of mechanical equipment (eg a GUI)
Like Mercury, but for MASOPS shuttles.
Human Resources

HR Shared Services
HR Team who answer all employee queries via hr_queries@ocado.com or 01707 228049 as well as look after all HR admin
Health, Safety & Environment
Health & Safety Executive

Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning
Heating and air conditioning for Ocado buildings
Non Food items sold via Ocado.com - picked at NFDC and merged into the customer's order at the CFC.
Input / Output
Intelligent Accumulating Sensing Module

Inter-CFC Inventory Transfer
A system that is used to transfer inventory between UK Live CFCs

Identity Card
The photographic identity card provided to all employees for security and access control
Application which deals with customer data. Used for registration and customer detail management by non-food, and being adopted by webshop.

Inbound Decant GUI 
The application used at specific stations for decanting.
Institute of Environmental Management and Assessment
Green collapsible storage boxes/folding trays used to carry products in CFC1. IFCO is the brand, IFCO Systems is the manufacturer

Intelligent Flow Rate Control
The system used to control the number of totes that are allowed into an aisle at a particular point in time.

Inside Marshal (CFC Dispatch) 
Responsible for preparing loaded dollies from frameload for dispatch in trailers and vans.
Inventory Move Event

Inventory Management Station
Rainbow peripheral to enable dealing with all stock issues, purge etc.
The part of the CFC operation involved in receiving incoming stock and storing it in crane systems ready for the outbound operation.
See Profibus
Institute of Ocupational Safety and Health

Inbound Resource Planning 
The process of determining people and machine resources required to handle the inbound operation.

Inventory Support Team Member
Someone responsible for the operation in a particular area of the CFC. Specifically, ISTMs are responsible for inventory adjustments and pick skips.
Checked out but not yet delivered.

Inventory Transaction Log 
Refers to the INVENTORY_TRANSACTION table in the WMS database used to record all events which happen to inventory.
IT Project Manager

Import Your Favourites 
Feature that allows new users to import their favourites from other websites

Junction Box 
An electrical component of conveyor systems
Agreed funding with suppliers for things such as bannersand sampling.
Juice is our employee magazine which is produced every two months. You can see back copies by clicking on the link on the left.
Kale is a back office application which is used to manage aspects of the webshop
Manufacturer of pick-to-lights (PTLs) in CFC1 and CFC2. The entire control system is referred to by the Helpdesk as KBS.

Key Performance Indicator
A method of tracking or measuring the progress of a system or business target
The pick station team
Key Volume Indicator

Keyboard, Video and Mouse switch 
Used to enable one set of peripherals to be connected to multiple terminals.
Learning and Development
Local Area Control
Language used to program PLCs. Some PLCs also use STL.
One of the programming formats used when programming PLCs via Step7. Others include STL, Function Block and SCL
Large bot used to recover production bots on the grid while it is live and for other maintenance works above the grid.

Large Goods Vehicle
An LGV driver safely delivers the customer orders to each spoke in time for the appropriate customer delivery slots.
See Pick-by-light.
Logged In Home Page
Sometimes used to refer to the WMS database (after the company that originally supplied it: Logistics & Industrial Systems Ltd).

Last Mile 2  
Project to develop the next CFC

Last Mile Solutions 
A very old name for Ocado, this is why the work access group is called LMS. This now refers to an IT department called Last Mile Systems; encompassing Routing, Delivery, Marketing, Order Management and others. Last Mile has also been chosen as a generic namespace for stuff that will be served to Ocado Retail and Morrisons.
When a pallet cannot be put away due to a location issue

If a location can’t have containers added to or removed from it due to a physical fault, it is considered Locked. A location that cannot have containers added is considered InLocked; one that cannot have them removed is considered OutLocked.
Logistics Development
Java library used to send logs from java applications using logback or log4j to logstash.
The delivery routing system which provides slot booking service to the Webshop. Also the name of the infrastructure used by Routing, Delivery, Order Management and Courier Management Systems.
Lifting Operations & Lifting Equipment Regulations
Routing logic within CFC zone pick floors which is invoked during times when maximum capacity is required.
Log Out Shopping
A Marketing campaign where a customer is rewarded if they shop X times within Y weeks.

License Plate Number
A barcode value often used in reference to a tote ID, or a van numberplate. It is different from the Container ID; the Container ID is used for planning work (picks, loads etc) against a systemic container that might not exist yet. It only lasts for one Outbound Day. An LPN is the barcode on the container itself and refers to the physical container.

Low Price Promise 
We promise to match prices on any Tesco product that we also sell. If we turn out to be more expensive for that product, we will send the customer a voucher for the difference.
Long Pallet Truck
The term referred to for our employees that are paid for weekly

Ocado Management Committee
This refers to the Ocado group of Directors who lead our business.

One act to cut up some meat or fish in the MSC; more generally an act to combine eaches of one or more (primal) sku and create eaches of another (derivative) sku. In other countries this could be generalized to other purposes eg a bakery zone.
The part of Dispatch that groups frameloaded dollies according to what vehicle they need to go onto. This is potentially nontrivial, when the ambient and chill zones empty at different rates.
System used to record funding.
Newer control protocol used to communicate with PLCs (replacing SCALP). It is used for all MHE in CFC2, apart from MASOPS Shuttles which use HMP.
Also a transactional email communications application used to send emails about customer orders and accounts (registration, receipts, etc) in the “live” UK system.
A messaging protocol used for communications between PLC and WCS.
Our in-house rostering system. Time and Attendance system used across hourly paid employees (replaced SMART)
tag: CFC Operations, General Merchandise and Service Delivery

meaning:
Multi Functional Device
Photocopiers with the ability to copy, print and scan

Materials Handling Equipment (also Mechanical Handling Equipment)
Used for moving totes around the CFC includes automated cranes and conveyors. Also used to refer to the subsystem in the WMS that manages cranes and conveyors.
Midas is a back office application which is used to manage aspects of the webshop
MiJourney is our online Appraisal tool used mainly by Head Office employees
MiLearning is an Ocado-developed google site, which aims to provide a dynamic ‘one-stop shop’ for learning at Ocado. Find out more by clicking on the link on the left.
A system for visualizing Outbound Zonepick. Currently (Aug 2015) uses DirectX - may be rewritten to use Unity? Written in C# and can be scripted using IronPython.
Used to test user processes. It mocks out the RF server and shows what all the users are currently doing on a GUI.
MiOcado is the place where Personal Shoppers, LGV Drivers and CSTMs can view roster information, book holidays etc
Minor Incident Report

Management Information System (also AIS: Atlas Information System) 
Web applications that are used to report on and manage the CFC operation. Divided into “Green MIS” which is for reporting and “Red MIS” which is used for admin (and can do more dangerous things).
Metamorphosis Support Crew
Minimum Order Quantity

Manual Recovery Bot
Large bot used to recover production bots on the grid and for other maintenance works above the grid.
Manual Replenishment Trolley Pick

Manual Service Counter
The area in the CFC where items are manually prepared for a customer such as butchery and fishmongery

There are CP (Customer Pack) containers - what we send to the user, UP (Unopened Pack) which contains sealed inbound product and OP (Opened Pack) which contains inbound meat/fish that has been opened and started being cut up (this reduces the shelf life).
Mean Time Between Failures
Mean Time To Repair
Motor Vehicle Incident Report

Notify Container Location
Message sent between WCS/Atlases containing a container's location e.g. when a container reaches a decision point or barcode reader.

Non-Disclosure Agreement
Used to prevent information about Ocado from being leaked to other sources
Nothing Done Events
National Examination Board Occcupational Safety and Health
Narrow Edge Leading. Some departments use this terminlogy to describe Rainbow Decant stations to distinguish between the different styles and orientation of the travelling totes
New and Obsolete: it is the method sed to restrict movement of stock when a product withdrawal is required
A fileserver which has very high levels of availability - used to provide storage for database systems and network storage.
The IT team that looks after the Network and UNIX systems.

Non Food Distribution Centre 
The warehouse in Welwyn

Notification of Absence
Either a form or email sent to the relevant HR/Resource Planning team (depending on where you work) when you have notified Ocado you will not be coming into work
The event where a container passes a barcode scanner and the scanner fails to read the barcode.
New products to be launched by suppliers.
Non weighted ATP
Explains our values and principles and can be viewed by clicking on the link on the left.
Ocado's software solutions that run and support CFC1 and CFC2.

Ocado Delivery Device 
The CSTM delivery software written internally to run on the U1s - this uses a satnav provided by NavMii
Pather - Part of Loki maintained by Geo in LMS, this does the calculation of drive times between points.
Ocado Delivery Pass

Operational Data Store
A data warehouse db.
Is made up of the Facilities Team, Reception Team, Mail Room Teams and Shuttle Bus Services. Provides services that assist staff in their day to day functions.
Online Supplier Portal
Operations Manager

Outside Marshal 
Working in the CFC dispatch area, this role handles returning dekit and dolly delivery to frameload
Order Management

Order Management and Delivery
Refers to any system involved in the fulfillment of an order before and after it goes to a CFC

Ocado On Demand 
Old name for Ocado delivery pass
Out Of Stock

Open or Opened Pack 
See MSC Containers
A One Page Event is where all products displayed are categorised into lines based on a common feature between them all. For example all oranges appear on one line.
Operational Excellence Team

Orders per Week
Measure of throughput
Ocado Route Balancing System
OL - all the stock in an order for a given sku. If not enough stock is available for the SKU chosen by the customer, this may be a Substitute Order Line.
Sometimes called a Customer Order to avoid confusion with Purchase Order. An order for a customer.

Ocado Smart Platform 
OSP is our end-to-end software and technology systems together with our physical CFC equipment. It's modular and can be build to almost any size. It's scaleable and can be built in multiple phases. It requires less space than the CFC kit we currently use in Hatfield and Dordon. It's fast to deploy and even more efficient in terms of capital and operating costs. The idea is that a business can buy what it needs and it can grow with them.

Order Storage Retrieval
Method of picking and packing where the items are brought to you by the system; a large system of conveyor, lifts, cranes and picking stations used to efficiently handle low-velocity products (those of which we sell far fewer than most products). This is the oldest ASOPS system in Ocado (CFC1), and is controlled by WMS.

Order Storage Retrieval v2 
A larger system of conveyor, lifts, cranes and picking stations used to efficiently handle low- to medium-velocity products (those of which we sell fewer than most products). This is an ASOPS system in CFC1, controlled by Atlas. It is almost exactly like MASOPS, except without storage towers and the supercontroller.
Individual cards per building which provide access via the access control terminal when the buildings are not manned with Security Guards
The part of the CFC operation involved in picking customer orders through to loading vans and trailers: all warehouse operations from collecting SKU from storage until delivery

A monitoring application used in CFC systems. Consists of Emu (a component to allow this info to be served up in the monitored application, eg using servlets), Gazelle (a tool for plotting and doing statistics on the monitored applications) and Squirrel (a system for collecting the info from the applications).
Ocado Vehicle Number

Pick and Deliver Point 
For cranes
A large diversion point - a sortation system
Automation in Ocado CFCs used to transport pallets from one location to another, typically from an inbound receiving area to a crane.
Ocado single sign on solution
Pre Buffer Buffer

Pick By Light 
Picking processes are aided by lights directing attention to stock locations. Also sometimes referred to as PTL - Pick To Light. Handled by an application called Light Gateway, which pretends to be a PLC and accepts mercury messages.
Post Checkout Page
Principal Contractor
Principal Designer

Pick Data Consumer. Adaptation Layer (Andover) or CFC Dispatch (Hatfield/Dordon) send the service data about what items were actually picked in the CFC for each order/route and where the orders are on the dollies/trailers. We (Delivery Systems) process this in PDC and then the data is used for things like calculating the actual cost of the order, making the data available on the driver's delivery device, generating receipts, etc

Personal Development Plan 
Your learning activities, usually linked with performance reviews
Pick Data Producer
Platform Data Scientist. See also DS = Data Scientist.

Production Environment
Generic term used to describe infrastructure that runs production systems.

Photo Electric Cell 
Used to sense the presence of a tote on the conveyor line
Normally - what proportion of all orders or customers have bought into the product, brand or category being discussed
Pallet Exit Point
A Personal Shopper is someone who works in a CFC and is responsible for picking and packing our customer's orders
Personal Expense Voucher
Used both for OSP-style WMS (ie the part of OSP-style CFCs responsible for inventory management), and now also for OSP-style CFCs in general. See also Atmosphere.
The central part of the OSP-style WMS. Responsible for a global overview of all inventory and containers in all zones, and issuing tasks to zones.
System from Waitrose that allows to know the promotions they are running and cost prices.
The action of taking an each from a storage location and placing it into a delivery tote. It is a type of Inventory Move.
A location where a crane will deposit a container so that its stock can be picked. Also used to describe the products surrounding a pick station
Pallet Infeed Point
Pallet Induct Point (for Cranes)
Performance Improvement Plan
Pallet Induct Point Other

Passive Infrared Sensor
Motion detector for automatic switch off of lights and also used within the intruder alarm units

Programmable Logic Controller 
Real-time industrialized embedded controller. Used to control cranes, conveyors, and other equipment. Communicates to WCS and SCADA. Ocado mainly use PLCs from Siemens in the S7 300 and S7 400 range.
Planned Maintenance
Project Manager

Pick and Drop 
A location where a crane or shuttle can pick up containers (not used for dropping off, despite the name). Sometimes there are also VPnDs (Vertical PnD).

Purchase Order
This is how requests for spend are raised for work required; work cannot be instructed without providing this number; an order placed with a supplier for some stock.

Product Owner
An individual (usually part of the Technology team) who is responsible for one or more of the systems maintained and developed by Ocado Technology.

Post Order Advice 
Error in purchase order (may item delisted, or order to wrong site, or not delivering today)
Order is incorrect because product has been delisted
Order is incorrect because it has gone to the wrong chamber of the supplier
Automatically updating ROG details when there are layout changes in warehouse (SKU location changes).
Placed Orders Count
Proof Of Delivery
Payment On Delivery

Personal Protective Equipment 
Items such as steel toe boots, hi-vis jackets etc. required when visiting or working in hazardous areas.
tag: CFC Operations, General Merchandise and Service Delivery

meaning:
Picks Per Hour 
A reporting metric for pickers in the CFC.

Pallet Pump Truck / Powered Pallet Truck
A small fork-lift truck used for moving pallets and dollies around the CFC. Used in the Dispatch and Receiving zones.

Process owned by the CFC which calculates the number of totes that will be used by an order. This is sent back to the routing system so they can more accurately schedule orders onto routes. See also: Cubing.
The Daemon responsible for deciding the aisles in which to place products. Also a GUI tool for the same. Written in C#
Two wire Master Slave Bus system used to connect field devices to PLCs. Used instead of separately directly wiring devices back to the PLC. Other similar systems include Interbus and AS-I Bus
External company that provides competitor pricing data.
The small swipe unit for accessing doors or speed gates that are security protected

Personal Shopper
An individual who picks and packs a customer's shopping
Conveyor supplier
Product Scoping Document

Payment Service Provider
Third party company that processes payments transactions
A system for inventory and user management in CFC1&2.
All the products of the same SKU in the same purchase order.

Removing inventory from the CFC for various reasons, either because it is out of date or has a quality issue or needs to be returned to the supplier or is not the most recent issue of a magazine. This involves Purge Orders and Purge Customers (eg Company Shop, Skip, Food Bank etc). In CFC 1&2 Purge Orders are just like other orders, but with a flag set.
Shelf life expired or beyond Ocado shelf life
Provision and Use of Work Equipment Regulations
This is a program that can be used to automate outputs from BigQuery. Most commonly used to update instances of reports each day without the need to manually do.

Responsible Accountable Consult Inform
A matrix document that identifies who is Responsible, Accountable, Consulted and Informed regarding an item of work (often project work).

Routing And Delivery 
The operation that manages the process of getting vans and trailers to their destinations and planning which customer orders should go on a van for efficient delivery.

Rainbow is the code name for the development projects which form the Automation of the new OSP. The projects include: Bots, Grid, RT, Pick Stations, Decant Stations, Safety System, Wireless Communication Systems etc...
The reporting platform for OSP-style CFCs.

Data messages as stored in the Data Lake. This is "unclean" data, with high granularity, that may be used on their own, but without any guarantees, and they need to be transformed into something more business like before they are useful for reporting purposes.

Rainbow Communication
Ocado system to communicate wirelessly with bots
Route Data Producer
Research Data Scientist. See also DS = Data Scientist.
The process whereby inventory on lorries from suppliers is created. Most inventory in the freezer is not received within the CFC but at a warehouse called Theale (see Autoreceiving).
For use when a piece of outgoing mail needs to be tracked. Item will be processed as 1st Class mail and recipient is required to sign on delivery.
The act of replenishing stock - can mean a crane delivering a container to a pickface from a storage location, or a person moving stock from a pickface to a picking location (e.g. array).
The location/s behind the pickface on Crane aisles where the pickface storage is more than one position deep.
All of the heads of department within Retail. E.g. Thomas = Head of Marketing and Insight. Also a meeting on Tuesday mornings of this group plus Lawrence

A system to manage user processes. It uses a sort of scanner called an RF gun worn by the personal shopper on their wrist. In CFC1&2 it communicates with an application called the RF server using XML over telnet. In OSP-type CFCs, the RF gun runs a web browser and communicates with a web application on the server.
Matrix (both horizontal and vertical) racking storage of totes before induct (levels C and D - so far)

Reporting, MIS, Admin, SCADA
Software suite for Rainbow CFCs.

Range Management System
The Range Management System is responsible for creating and maintaining the standards of the products sold, creating and maintaining information on suppliers, and providing product information for the Ocado webshop including listing and delisting SKU's supplied by trading partners, including information such as cost price, description, VAT rate etc

Registered Non Shopped 
All users who leave the webshop after registration without shopping
Web Service which handles the mobile app requests.

Replenishment Ordering Group 
(RMS/Utopia terminology) - a group of products which are ordered together, from the same supplier, to the same CFC.
All the stock that will ultimately end up on one van (even if it is delivered via a lorry to a spoke).
Direct order and delivery from supplier to Ocado
Supplier delivery to Waitrose and then Waitrose delivery to Ocado. Ocado order goes to supplier.
Supplier delivery to Waitrose and then Waitrose delivery to Ocado. Ocado order goes to Waitrose.

Resource Planning
Planning (formerly known as Resource Planning) sits under the Supply Chain & Planning business stream (which is headed up by director Mark Watson). The team provide the optimal number of Personal Shoppers, LGV drivers and CSTMs required to operate the CFC and deliver all customer orders on each day.

Routing Systems
Team that develops engine that takes orders and decides what vans to put them on and where they go
Rainbow Tote: used in Rainbow style CFCs as the storage tote inside the grid
Rainbow Tote with a red Delivery Tote inside, these can either contain customer orders or just bags
Ready To Eat
Redundancy and Tote Flow

Return To Vendor 
A location that a crane or conveyor will deposit a container when there is something wrong (profile violation, unreadable barcode, etc).

Return to Work
The meeting that takes place with your manager on your return to work after a period of absence.

Right to Work 
The documentation required to be presented to an employer to evidence the ongoing right to live and work in the UK

Reverse Flows
A section of the CFC where totes are processed after returning from a delivery. In RVF totes may be cleaned or repaired, they will then be bagged and sent to ZP.

Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition
The fault visualization system used in Ocado CFCs which displays and log faults and errors detected by PLCs controlling the automation. System used in CFC1 and CFC2 is also referred as Ocean SCADA and system for OSP-like CFCs is referred as Hawk (or Hawk SCADA). Hawk is a web app, whereas CFC1&2 Scada is handled by a desktop app.
A control protocol used to communicate between the WCS and PLCs. Used for legacy systems in CFC1, replaced by the Mercury protocol for newer systems.
Used to scan the barcodes on all the FTs and trolley in the trolley.
Discarding of a particular item in a customer's order - e.g no stock available (alternative might be supplied)
Scribe is a webshop content management system which is used to set up various aspects of the webshop
Supply Chain Systems
Supply Chain Team
Supply Chain Team based in Inbound

Service Delivery
Service Delivery is the area of our business which is responsible for the physical aspects of getting the order to the customer, whilst delivering exceptional customer service both on the doorstep through our CSTMs and remotely through our Contact Centre teams.
Some search terms will automatically link customers to specific part of the website that is outside of the normal search results.
The word or phrase that a customer enters into the search bar on the website when they are looking for a particular product.
Software used to send emails and attach incentives (e.g. vouchers) to customers
A safety system intended to stop the waste conveyor / baler machine to prevent injury if a worker gets too close
Advertising on the Ocado.com website that is sold to suppliers. This is usually in the form of banners.
Another way of saying SKU, that refers specifically to the product number and is used interchangeably with SKU in some of the data tables.
All the routes delivered in the same lorry, or in the case of trailer sets, the same Ambient/Chill pair.
A very small storage tote used for small SKUs in CFC1.

A machine that sorts completed customer totes towards the correct deck of lanes in the Tote Buffer. Automation which sorts totes to multiple conveyors outfeeds at high throughputs. In Ocado CFCs they are used to sort completed totes coming from zone picking (via two conveyors) to the correct buffer decks (via 4 conveyors). There is one in CFC1 and two in CFC2.
See video http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Szxgy0qSwlw
This is when we are unable to deliver a particular item on a customer’s order.

Transportation device for a single tote used to store and retrieve in an OSR system. There is one shuttle per storage level which is fed via lift at the front of the aisle. Also used for Pallets in CFC2.

Stock Keeping Unit (pronounced "skew") 
A unique identifier for each distinct product. Stock Keeping Unit - an individual type of product (represented by a standard code and distinguishes product types, as well as versions of a product, for example when a product has a Christmas label). SKU numbers can be searched on the Ocado website and will return the product that matches that number.
Service Level Agreement
Section Manager
PandaSSO solution deployed on atmosphere and/or inside CFC’s for retailers.
Ocado’s delivery saver scheme. Also gives customers discount on certain products and entry into certain Marketing initiatives.
Senior Management Team
Service Organisation Controls - system controls that meet the criteria outlined in the Trust Services Principles for Security, Availability, Processing Integrity, Confidentiality and Privacy
Standalone email on one topic. Eg. a Wine Solus email.
Safety Pass Alliance
For use when a piece of outgoing mail needs to be tracked and guaranteed for next day delivery. The recipient is required to sign on delivery.
A Marketing campaign where a customer is given a reward if they place an order above their average basket.

Standard Productive Hour
The amount of work expected to be done in an hour (dependent on the type of activity).
Single Point Of Failure
A spoke site is a place where we transport customer orders to so that they can be delivered locally direct to the customer's door. We currently have 20 spoke sites across the country.
A period of time that technology teams work in. This is part of the Agileway of working.
Short Pallet Truck
Lanes of conveyor that bring completed routes to the person that is going to put the totes with customers orders into the frames

Structured Query Language 
For writing database queries
Shoe Sorter
Safety Steering Committee
Safety Scheme in Procurement
Single Sign-On
Safe Systems of Work
tag: CFC Operations, General Merchandise and Service Delivery

meaning: Support Services Team Manager (specific to CFC Hatfield)

Storage Tote
A tote used to hold inbound stock in a crane system.  Storage totes are yellow and green.
The Ocado PLC code library used to control the automation in Ocado CFCs.

Smaller Than A Tote
Items that will fit into a DT, in the context of delivery via courier rather than Ocado van. See BTAT.
The Siemens software package used for programming PLCs.

Statement List
One of the programming formats used when programming PLCs via Step7. Others include Ladder Logic, Function Block and SCL
Senior Trading Managers are responsible for managing a group of buyers and product categories.

A location within a Crane aisle used for storing product for which there is no available pickface location. Once a pickface location becomes available (usually when all product already there has been picked) the crane will be asked to carry out a Replen move.

Subs are products that were substituted for the product a customer actually ordered. This is often done when the ordered product goes out of stock. The sub is supposed to be an equivalent product that we think the customer would have chosen had they known their ordered product was out of stock.
The part of Ocado that manages Appointments and POs.
A powerful data visualisation and reporting tool, used by the Ocado retail business to access their data in the Cloud Data Platform.
Partial decanting of a pallet - usually of a slow moving SKU

Tote Buffer
a section of the CFC where delivery totes (DT and FT) are sent when they contain all ordered items. From the TBF, containers will be loaded to vans/trailers.
Trailer Data Producer

Tote Gripper Assembly(?)
Part of the bot hoisting down to pickup/drop off storage containers.
Conveyor supplier

The Ocado Council works constructively on behalf of all employees; it was established in February 2010 and allows every single person at Ocado formal representation through an elected employee committee. Find out more by clicking on the link on the left.
The Ocado Foundation is the not-for-profit bit of Ocado and the focus for all our charitable and fundraising activity. Find out more by clicking the link on the left.

The Ocado Way describes our 'people' values and what is expected of you in your role. It also describes the expectations for more senior roles that you may want to develop into. View the document by clicking on the link on the left.

The Helpful Ocado Recommender
A recommendations service maintained by the backend team serving recommendations based on where the customer is on the site.

Testing Harness and GUI 
A PLC emulator. It also comes with a Swing GUI that can be run separately that either shows what the current status of the system, or replays logs from scenario tests. See also MiniM. Different from Simulation (which also mocks out the WCS and only applies to Outbound Zonepick).

Tote In Machine
Machine to place DTs into rainbow container ready to be placed in the grid.
Chill unload area
Team Leader
Three Letter Acronym
Team Manager

Tote Out Machines - they are used to remove customer totes (DT/FTs - the same as in CFC 1 & 2) out of Rainbow Totes (RTs or "bins") that are the slightly large containers that are stacked up to form the hive and can be carried by the bots. Bins get dropped off at a TOM, the DT is removed and dropped straight into the spur lane, and the empty bin is picked up by the bot and taken away.
A weekly email to the whole Ocado customer base detailing this week’s best promotions.
The tabs along the top of the Ocado.com website that link to specific parts of the website. These change as new events come and go. ‘Recipes’ and ‘Smart Pass’ would be examples.

A tote is a plastic box or crate used in our CFCs to transport goods from one place to another. Red totes are delivery totes carrying chilled or ambient goods. Blue totes are delivery totes carrying frozen goods to up to three customers. Yellow and green totes are storage totes.
Sometimes referred to as TB. Consolidates totes from all areas into routes. Also used to refer to the place where delivery totes are accumulated ready for dispatch
Automation in Ocado CFCs used to transport totes from one location to another, Ocado has used several different suppliers for this over the years including Knapp, CSI, TGW.

Trolley Pick 
A section of the CFC where picking occurs by taking a trolley of totes around storage locations in a similar way to supermarket shopping - also refers to the action of this type of picking. Low efficiency but easy and flexible to set up and run. Once common, this now only occurs in the freezer.

Totes per Hour
Measure of throughput
Tesco Price Match
Tote Push Message
Tesco Price Match

When the dollies for routes sent to a spoke are split into ambient and chill halves and the ambients loaded onto an Ambient Trailer and vice versa. Typically the first two dollies on the chill side match up with the first two dollies on the ambient side etc.
A storage container with very low sides - cardboard collars are often used to contain products in them. In CFC1 only.
The automated system for handling Trays which comprises of conveyors, lifts and cranes in the Ambient area of CFC1.
Suppliers support promotions, the amount of money they give us per promotional item sold is a trigger. We normally state margin including triggers.
Relates to LGV (large good vehicles) or lorries; the truck is the power unit at the front, trailer is the bit at the back
The process of moving goods from CFC to a spoke
A complete solution built and delivered by a contractor (rather than Ocado acting as integrator and / or supplying elements of the solution).
This Year / Last Year / Next Year / This Week - used in reporting to refer to time periods relative to the date of the report.
The portable device used in vans - it contains the routing information for the van's deliveries and a sat nav service.
The personal device in each delivery van that provides delivery information and a SatNav
Universal Accumulation Conveyor Control

User Acceptance Testing
System testing that is done before it goes live
Universal Landing Page

Unopened Pack 
MSC package

Units (eaches) per Hour
A measurement of the rate at which someone does a particular task, like picking (PPH), frameloading, MSC manufacture or Receiving.
Measure of throughput.

Uninterruptible Power Supply
Used to maintain power to key components in Ocado CFCs in the event of power loss. Typical examples are PLCs and Network Switches.

User Requirement 
Document which highlights Ocado's expectations from a supplier

Union of Shop, Distributive and Allied Workers
Since 2011 Ocado has had a voluntary union recognition agreement with USDAW in respect of personal shoppers, CSTMs and LGV drivers.
tag: CFC Operations, General Merchandise and Service Delivery

meaning: The system that supports the Supply Chain with forecasting and ordering of stock, tracking, pack size, order quantities, Inbound scheduling

Vertical Buffer
Part of peripheral to allow multiple containers' vertical accumulation to allow bots to pick them up from lower depth.

Verified by Visa
Visa’s brand name for 3D Secure.
V Driven Rollet Conveyor
Morrisons Contact Centre system

Vehicle Flight Recorder
This is a device in the van that returns detailed GPS data. Also collects temperature data. Can be used to retrieve other van data such as acceleration, braking g, and the like.

Virtual IP Address
Usually constructed using 2 characters for the environment (e.g. ‘pe’ for ‘production’), 3 characters for the service, (e.g. odn for Odin), and 3 numbers so we can have many instances of a service. e.g. peodn001. Each VIP machine usually also has a user on that host with the same name. In CFC2 the first character denotes the type of application (eg w for wms, i for inbound, o for outbound) and the penultimate one denotes the cfc (eg 2 for CFC2). Only for CFC1&2 - not for OSP.

Virtual Machine
Uses a similar naming convention but with 6 letters and 2 digits, eg pe for production + dd for dordon + ka for cassandra + 01 for instance number.

Very Narrow Aisle
Pallet racking serviced by a specialised PPT due to the narrower spacing.

A section of the CFC containing pallet racks used for longer term storage than cranes due to the longer life or slower movement of the products. Was originally a void as we paid less council tax if this part of the warehouse didn't have an actual floor, therefore it just had a dirt floor. Now Void only refers to a business process and not an area (the totebuffer and OSR2 now occupy this area).

Virtual/Vertical PnD 
A location that is shared by the lift and a crane, so the lift can drop the container and the shuttle can pick it from the same location, also there are outgoing vPnDs where the crane can drop the container and the lift can pick it.
Velocity Weighted ATP
A group of totes (there are 42 waves per day)

Warehouse Control System 
An application sitting between PLCs and higher level systems (Atlas, WMS), providing an abstraction of protocols used for communication with the hardware. If the systems are thought of like a human being, then the PLC controls the heartbeat and movement of the muscles, the WCS knows how to walk from A to B, Atlas (or WMS) knows why to go to B.
The customer-facing website. Any one of: ocado.com, fetch.co.uk, sizzle.co.uk or groceries.morrisons.com.
Wide Edge Leading. Some departments use this terminlogy to describe Rainbow Decant stations to distinguish between the different styles and orientation of the travelling totes

Where’s My Order
An order delivery estimation shown on the Webshop, this hits the delivery webservice (maintained by delivery systems) which estimates the predicted delivery time for an order based on events and GPS.

Warehouse Management Systems
The software systems and applications which control the warehouse.
tag: CFC Operations, Logistics Development and Ocado Technology

meaning: Web Service
Waitrose
External Totes
Year on year / Week on week.
Identifies a number that covers the start of the Ocado year to the current date.

Zone Pick 
A section of the CFC where items from an order are placed into one or more DTs. The process is called picking and is executed by a personal shopper who has a set of products around a station to pick from.
Zone Pick Conveyor
Zero Pressure Conveyor

Zone Pick GUI
A GUI used at a zone pick station
